com.redhat.rhn.common.localization
Class XmlMessages

java.lang.Object
  com.redhat.rhn.common.localization.XmlMessages

public final class XmlMessages
extends java.lang.Object

Utility (Singleton) class to get and format messages centralized by package. Messages are assumed to be in a ResourceBundle called StringResource in a given class' package. ie, If the class is my.package.foo.Bar, the methods will look for the ResourceBundle my.package.foo.StringResource. (The actual file can be a subclass of ResourceBundle or a properties file.) The ResourceBundle keys are assumed to be prefixed with the class name. ie, if the class is my.package.foo.Bar and the key is msg, the methods will then look for the key Bar.msg.

getBundle

protected java.util.ResourceBundle getBundle(java.lang.String bundleName,
                                             java.util.Locale locale)
Gets the resource bundle, first checking our internal cache

Parameters:
bundleName - name of the resource bundle
locale - locale used to retrieve the resource bundle
Returns:
the resource bundle for the given bundleName and locale, always non-null. (An exception is thrown if the bundle can't be found.)

getMessage

public java.lang.String getMessage(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                   java.util.Locale locale,
                                   java.lang.String key)
Obtain a string from the resource file that doesn't require formatting. See the format() methods for obtaining strings that require formatting.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to which the string belongs
locale - the locale used to find the resource bundle
key - the key for the string to be obtained from the resource bundle
Returns:
the message for the given key

                               java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.String arg1)
Convenience method to format a string from the resource bundle, which takes a single argument.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to which the string belongs
locale - the locale used to find the resource bundle
key - the key for the string to be obtained from the resource bundle
arg1 - the first argument to use in the formatted text
Returns:
the formatted message for the given key and argument

format

public java.lang.String format(java.lang.Class clazz,
                               java.util.Locale locale,
                               java.lang.String key,
                               java.lang.Object... args)
Method to format a string from the resource bundle. This method allows the user of this class to directly specify the bundle package name to be used. Allows us to have resource bundles in packages without classes. Eliminates the need for "Dummy" classes.

Parameters:
clazz - the class to which the string belongs
locale - the locale used to find the resource bundle
key - the key for the string to be obtained from the resource bundle
args - the arguments that should be applied to the string obtained from the resource bundle. Can be null, to represent no arguments
Returns:
the formatted message for the given key and arguments

getKeys

public java.util.Enumeration getKeys(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                     java.util.Locale locale)
Gets the keys of all the strings in the specified class and locale's resource bundle.

Parameters:
clazz - Class of the resource bundle
locale - locale used to retrieve the resource bundle
Returns:
the Iterator of all the keys
